title: Turn the Constant into log
text: Use the definition of logarithm, we can get $$3=\log_{3}\left(27\right)$$ since $$3^3=27$$.
speech: Use the definition of logarithm, we can get  3 is equal to, the log base 3 of 27,  since  3 cubed is equal to 27 .
pacedSpeech: Use the definition of logarithm, we can get   3 is equal to, the log base 3 of 27,

title: Match Bases
text: With all term containing same log base, the log can be removed, so it becomes $$x \left(x+6\right)=27$$. Solve for $$x$$.\n$$x^2+6-27=0$$ We can factor the quadratic and get $$\left(x+9\right) \left(x-3\right)=0$$. $$x=-9$$ or $$x=3$$.
speech: With all term containing same log base, the log can be removed, so it becomes  x, parentheses x plus 6,  is equal to 27 . Solve for  x .\n x squared plus 6 minus 27 is equal to 0  We can factor the quadratic and get  parentheses x plus 9,  times, parentheses x minus 3,  is equal to 0 .  x, is equal to, negative 9  or  x, is equal to 3 .

title: Check for Constrains
text: Given $$\log_{a}\left(b\right)$$, $$b$$ can not be negative. We can omit the negative answer and get $$x=3$$ as the only solution for the equation.
speech: Given  the log base a of b, ,  b  can not be negative. We can omit the negative answer and get  x is equal to 3  as the only solution for the equation.
